CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In particular , the acenedithiophene family , in which two thiophenes are fused at the ends of acenes , such as benzodithiophenes ( BDTs ) , 8 naphthodithiophenes ( NDTs ) , 9 and anthradithiophenes ( ADTs ) , 10 offers multiple advantages over other classes owing to their ease of functionalization at the α-positions of thiophene substructures for easy and precise cross-coupling polymerization. Also , integration of thiophene with acene rings into a rigid and coplanar entity facilitates π-electron delocalization and induces strong π-π stacking for efficient charge transport. For example , Takimiya and co-workers reported four different NDTn isomers as shown in Figure 1 , which allowed to create a broad variety of NDTn - based polymer semiconductor materials , and high OFET performance with mobility of up to 0.77 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 based on PNDT3BT was achieved. 11 However , despite these numerous attractive properties of NDT - based polymer semiconductors , their limited solubility in organic solvents has hindered their widespread applications in organic electronics and optoelectronics. 12 To achieve the solubility and thin film uniformity required in solution processed OPVs and OFETs , NDT1 and NDT3 functionalized with two alkoxy groups were synthesized and applied in semiconductor materials recently ( Figure 1 ). 13 In addition , it was found that , compared with linear - fused NDT units , the copolymer incorporating the angular - fused NDT units can pack into higher ordered structures , thereby achieving higher OFET mobilities. It was also reported that angular - fused NDT has a lower - lying HOMO energy level than that of linearfused NDT , which could be beneficial for better air stability and greater open - circuit voltage ( V oc ) for polymer solar cells ( PSCs ). 9c Very recently , our group reported a broad bandgap D-A copolymer PzNDTTPD based on 4,9-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-naphtho [1,2-b:5,6-b′]dithiophene and thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6dione ( TPD ). 14 The polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) with PzNDTTPD as donor and [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as acceptor demonstrated a PCE of 5.26% with a high V oc of 0.91 V compared to the linear NDT - TPD - based copolymer PNDTTPD with a PCE of 4.0% and a V oc of 0.69 V. 15 Meanwhile , high - performance p-channel fieldeffect transistors with hole mobility of 0.067 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and an on / off current ratio of 10^9 -10^10 were obtained. It is indicative that " zigzag " NDT (zNDT)-based D-A polymers probably possess unique and excellent optoelectronic properties when combined with a suitable acceptor moiety. On the other hand , we noted that benzodiathiazole (BT)-or benzoxadiazole (BO)based conjugated polymers are one of the most important organic semiconductors due to their easy preparation , excellent stability , and optoelectronic characteristics , and many efforts have been devoted to the design and synthesis of new BT / BO derivatives.

Let's think step by step.

The "Material Name" entities in the paragraph can be identified as follows:

1. Acenedithiophene
2. Benzodithiophenes (BDTs)
3. Naphthodithiophenes (NDTs)
4. Anthradithiophenes (ADTs)
5. PNDT3BT
6. NDTn isomers
7. PNDTTPD
8. PC71BM
9. PzNDTTPD
10. Benzodiathiazole (BT)
11. Benzoxadiazole (BO)

These are the names of specific materials that are mentioned in the paragraph, and they are all organic semiconductors or polymers that have been studied for their optoelectronic properties.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Material Name in the given paragraph:

1. Acenedithiophene
2. Benzodithiophenes (BDTs)
3. Naphthodithiophenes (NDTs)
4. Anthradithiophenes (ADTs)
5. PNDT3BT
6. PNDTTPD
7. PC71BM
8. PzNDTTPD

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities in the "Material Name" column:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Acenedithiophene |
| Benzodithiophenes (BDTs) |
| Naphthodithiophenes (NDTs) |
| Anthradithiophenes (ADTs) |
| PNDT3BT |
| PNDTTPD |
| PC71BM |
| PzNDTTPD |

Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In particular , the acenedithiophene family , in which two thiophenes are fused at the ends of acenes , such as benzodithiophenes ( BDTs ) , 8 naphthodithiophenes ( NDTs ) , 9 and anthradithiophenes ( ADTs ) , 10 offers multiple advantages over other classes owing to their ease of functionalization at the α-positions of thiophene substructures for easy and precise cross-coupling polymerization. Also , integration of thiophene with acene rings into a rigid and coplanar entity facilitates π-electron delocalization and induces strong π-π stacking for efficient charge transport. For example , Takimiya and co-workers reported four different NDTn isomers as shown in Figure 1 , which allowed to create a broad variety of NDTn - based polymer semiconductor materials , and high OFET performance with mobility of up to 0.77 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 based on PNDT3BT was achieved. 11 However , despite these numerous attractive properties of NDT - based polymer semiconductors , their limited solubility in organic solvents has hindered their widespread applications in organic electronics and optoelectronics. 12 To achieve the solubility and thin film uniformity required in solution processed OPVs and OFETs , NDT1 and NDT3 functionalized with two alkoxy groups were synthesized and applied in semiconductor materials recently ( Figure 1 ). 13 In addition , it was found that , compared with linear - fused NDT units , the copolymer incorporating the angular - fused NDT units can pack into higher ordered structures , thereby achieving higher OFET mobilities. 11. Benzoxadiazole (BO)

Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material:

1. Acenedithiophene

3. Naphthodithiophene (NDTs)
4. Anthradithiophene (ADTs)

Sure! Here are the valid entities presented as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In particular , the acenedithiophene family , in which two thiophenes are fused at the ends of acenes , such as benzodithiophenes ( BDTs ) , 8 naphthodithiophenes ( NDTs ) , 9 and anthradithiophenes ( ADTs ) , 10 offers multiple advantages over other classes owing to their ease of functionalization at the α-positions of thiophene substructures for easy and precise cross-coupling polymerization. Also , integration of thiophene with acene rings into a rigid and coplanar entity facilitates π-electron delocalization and induces strong π-π stacking for efficient charge transport. For example , Takimiya and co-workers reported four different NDTn isomers as shown in Figure 1 , which allowed to create a broad variety of NDTn - based polymer semiconductor materials , and high OFET performance with mobility of up to 0.77 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 based on PNDT3BT was achieved. 11 However , despite these numerous attractive properties of NDT - based polymer semiconductors , their limited solubility in organic solvents has hindered their widespread applications in organic electronics and optoelectronics. 12 To achieve the solubility and thin film uniformity required in solution processed OPVs and OFETs , NDT1 and NDT3 functionalized with two alkoxy groups were synthesized and applied in semiconductor materials recently ( Figure 1 ). 13 In addition , it was found that , compared with linear - fused NDT units , the copolymer incorporating the angular - fused NDT units can pack into higher ordered structures , thereby achieving higher OFET mobilities. It was also reported that angular - fused NDT has a lower - lying HOMO energy level than that of linearfused NDT , which could be beneficial for better air stability and greater open - circuit voltage ( V oc ) for polymer solar cells ( PSCs ). 9c Very recently , our group reported a broad bandgap D-A copolymer PzNDTTPD based on 4,9-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-naphtho [1,2-b:5,6-b′]dithiophene and thieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6dione ( TPD ). 14 The polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) with PzNDTTPD as donor and [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as acceptor demonstrated a PCE of 5.26% with a high V oc of 0.91 V compared to the linear NDT - TPD - based copolymer PNDTTPD with a PCE of 4.0% and a V oc of 0.69 V. 15 Meanwhile , high - performance p-channel fieldeffect transistors with hole mobility of 0.067 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and an on / off current ratio of 10^9 -10^10 were obtained. It is indicative that " zigzag " NDT (zNDT)-based D-A polymers probably possess unique and excellent optoelectronic properties when combined with a suitable acceptor moiety. On the other hand , we noted that benzodiathiazole (BT)-or benzoxadiazole (BO)based conjugated polymers are one of the most important organic semiconductors due to their easy preparation , excellent stability , and optoelectronic characteristics , and many efforts have been devoted to the design and synthesis of new BT / BO derivatives.

Let's think step by step.

1. First, let's identify the material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

* Mobility
* Solubility
* Thin film uniformity
* Open-circuit voltage (Voc)
* PCE (power conversion efficiency)
* HOMO energy level
* Bandgap
* Optoelectronic properties
2. Next, let's look for the values of these properties in the paragraph:

* Mobility: 0.77 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 (for PNDT3BT)
* Solubility: limited solubility in organic solvents (for NDT-based polymer semiconductors)
* Thin film uniformity: not explicitly mentioned
* Open-circuit voltage (Voc): 0.91 V (for PzNDTTPD-based PSCs)
* PCE (power conversion efficiency): 5.26% (for PzNDTTPD-based PSCs), 4.0% (for PNDTTPD-based PSCs)
* HOMO energy level: lower-lying (for angular-fused NDT compared to linear-fused NDT)
* Bandgap: broad bandgap (for PzNDTTPD)
* Optoelectronic properties: excellent (for "zigzag" NDT-based D-A polymers)
3. Finally, let's convert the values to the appropriate units:

* Mobility: 0.77 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
* Open-circuit voltage (Voc): 0.91 V
* PCE (power conversion efficiency): 5.26%, 4.0%
* HOMO energy level: lower-lying (no specific unit)
* Bandgap: broad bandgap (no specific unit)
* Optoelectronic properties: excellent (no specific unit)

Note that some of the material properties mentioned in the paragraph do not have explicit values mentioned, such as thin film uniformity. Additionally, some properties, such as the HOMO energy level and bandgap, do not have specific units mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here's the updated list of entities that refer to the Value of Material Property:

1. Mobility: 0.77 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 (for PNDT3BT)
2. Open-circuit voltage (Voc): 0.91 V (for PzNDTTPD-based PSCs)
3. PCE (power conversion efficiency): 5.26% (for PzNDTTPD-based PSCs), 4.0% (for PNDTTPD-based PSCs)

I removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to the Value of Material Property:

1. Solubility: limited solubility in organic solvents (for NDT-based polymer semiconductors) - This refers to the solubility of the material in solvents, which is not a property of the material itself, but rather a property of its interaction with solvents.
2. Thin film uniformity: not explicitly mentioned - This property is not explicitly mentioned in the given paragraph.
3. HOMO energy level: lower-lying (for angular-fused NDT compared to linear-fused NDT) - This refers to the energy level of the highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO), which is a property of the molecular structure of the material, but not directly related to its value as a material property.
4. Bandgap: broad bandgap (for PzNDTTPD) - This refers to the energy range within which the material allows electrical conductivity, which is a property of the material itself, but not directly related to its value as a material property.
5. Optoelectronic properties: excellent (for "zigzag" NDT-based D-A polymers) - This refers to the overall performance of the material in optoelectronic devices, which is a combination of various properties, including mobility, Voc, and PCE, but not a specific property itself.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities and their property values, presented in the same words as in the original paragraph:

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Mobility | 0.77 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 (for PNDT3BT) |
| Open-circuit voltage (Voc) | 0.91 V (for PzNDTTPD-based PSCs) |
| PCE (power conversion efficiency) | 5.26% (for PzNDTTPD-based PSCs), 4.0% (for PNDTTPD-based PSCs) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
